question: What is the effect of incorporating  degree‐heterogeneous networks structure in an SEIR model on disease dynamics, compared to a homogeneous‐mixing network? Analyze it using both deterministic analytical methods and stochastic simulations
next_plan:
The discovery, network construction, parameter calibration, stochastic simulations, and preliminary metric extraction have been completed.  Next, I will
1. Derive the deterministic SEIR equations for homogeneous mixing and heterogeneous mean-field (degree–partitioned) networks, compute epidemic threshold and final size analytically using the degree moments already obtained.
2. Summarize stochastic simulation results, produce additional plots (peak comparison), and compare quantitatively with deterministic predictions.
3. Write the full IEEE-style LaTeX manuscript with all sections (Title, Abstract, Introduction, Methodology, Results, Discussion, Conclusion, References, Appendix) incorporating analytical derivations, simulation tables, figures saved (results-31.png, results-32.png) and cite the literature collected.
The next iteration will perform the deterministic analysis via code (symbolic or numeric), then compile the paper in LaTeX format ready for submission.
